JUDGES: Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON , lawyers practising in GPE .

The applicant was director general of ORG ( Maa - amet ) at the material time . On DATE a criminal investigation was opened in respect of a number of land transactions involving the acquisition by private persons of plots of land covered by the rules on nature protection and the exchange of these plots for more valuable land owned by the ORG .

On DATE the applicant was charged with abuse of his official position and taking a bribe . On DATE he was taken into custody . His detention was authorised by ORG ( maakohus ) on DATE . On DATE ORG ( ringkonnakohus ) dismissed an appeal by the applicant . That decision was not subject to appeal .

On DATE the public prosecutor dismissed a request by the applicant for release . On DATE a similar request was dismissed by ORG . The applicant 's release was ordered by the public prosecutor on DATE .

In the meantime , the applicant appealed to ORG ( NORP ) , arguing that the provision of LAW ( ORG seadustik ) by which no appeal lay against a ORG decision concerning detention was unconstitutional . On DATE ORG declined to examine the complaint on the merits as in accordance with LAW , the LAW and its case - law , it could do so only if the applicant had no other judicial remedy . However , in the case at hand he had had such remedies : his complaint against the ORG decision authorising his detention had been examined by ORG and his subsequent request for release had been examined by ORG .

On DATE ORG , at the public prosecutor 's request , suspended the applicant from serving as the director general of ORG for the duration of the criminal proceedings . On DATE ORG upheld the decision , finding that his suspension had been lawful and well - founded as his continuing service would have adverse effects on the criminal proceedings . ORG noted :

“ ... [ S]uspension from office in the present case is a proportionate remedy as it is possible for [ the applicant ] to continue the commission of analogous criminal offences ( on ... võimalik jätkata analoogsete kuritegude toimepanemist ) specifically in connection with the post he holds ; cooperation between [ the applicant ] and his subordinates is also complicated as the subordinates are witnesses in the present case .

ORG finds that as criminal offences relating to abuse of power are involved , remaining in service in the same post would enable the suspect to continue the commission of criminal offences of the same kind ( võimaldab ... samalaadsete kuritegude toimepanemist jätkata ) . ... ”
That decision was not subject to appeal .
“ A suspect or accused shall be suspended from office at the request of ORG and on the basis of an order of a preliminary investigation judge or a court ruling if :
( CARDINAL ) he or she may continue to commit criminal offences ( võib jätkuvalt toime panna kuritegusid ) in the event that he or she remains in office ;
( CARDINAL ) his or her remaining in office may prejudice the criminal proceedings . ”
